701755f-b.title: Bronx: Schurz Avenue - Brinsmade Avenue
701755f-b.text:
Schurz Avenue, south side, at the foot of Brinsmmade Avenue
(near the shore of the East River), showing the Havemeyer Mansion
as it looked after it was remodeled by Collis P. Huntington, the
railroad magnate, who later bought the house. During the American
Revolution the 8ritish, under General Howe, landed here on October 12,
1778 for their attack on Westchester. The G. W. Bromley map of 1927
shows fhe Mansion to be occupied by the Sisters of the Divine Com-
passion.
1906
Gift of Randall Comfort
701755f-b.folder: Schurz Avenue & Brinsmade Avenue, Bronx, NY
